messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] RE: newbie question/unschooling an only child
messages.msgSnippet: ... in a couple of months, and I know Grace Llewelyn has the not back to school camp there every year. Where in Oregon are you moving? I live in Corvallis
messages.messageBody:
>>However, we're moving back to Oregon
in a couple of months, and I know Grace Llewelyn has the "not back to
school camp" there every year.>>

Where in Oregon are you moving? I live in Corvallis and we have a growing unschooling/homeschooling group here. My son is going to Not Back To School Camp and we have friends who go to the Unschooling Chautauqua you mentioned.

--
~Mary, unschooling mom to Conor (16) and Casey (11)

"Just today I'm going to be utterly present for my children, I'm going to be in their world (not just doing my own thing while they do theirs), I'm going to really hear them, I'm going to prepare myself to be present starting right now."
~Ren Allen




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: newbie question/unschooling an only child
messages.msgSnippet: Kathryn, Unfortunately, we re not too close to the conferences you mentioned, but I would love to make it one. However, we re moving back to Oregon in a couple
messages.messageBody:
Kathryn,

Unfortunately, we're not too close to the conferences you mentioned,
but I would love to make it one. However, we're moving back to Oregon
in a couple of months, and I know Grace Llewelyn has the "not back to
school camp" there every year. My son still has a couple of years
before he can go (it's for 13+), but he's already looking forward to
it. There's also a week-long unschooling coastal camping trip every
year in Oregon, so that should be fun.

Carri Ann
